title: Old Woman

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of brush and black ink and watercolor on cream japanese paper.

description: After serving in World War I, where he mastered the machine-gun, Dix began making art that set out to reveal society’s immorality and ugly truths. In this watercolor, an old prostitute’s wrinkled exterior and toothless, puckered mouth remind the viewer of the inevitability of death while playing on our vulnerability to vanity, greed, and lust.
medium_display: Brush and black ink and watercolor on cream Japanese paper
inscriptions: Signed recto, lower right, in graphite: "DIX"; lower left, in graphite: "DIX 317"; inscribed verso, lower left, in graphite: "12 / 248 / Nr. 200"; lower center, in graphite: "um 1922"; lower right, in graphite: "189 Greisin / 106 / 35" [encircled]
credit_line: Gift of Dorothy Braude Edinburg to the Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection
publication_history:
Suse Pfäffle, Otto Dix: Werkverzeichnis der Aquarelle und Gouachen (Stuttgart, 1991), cat. A 1923/116, p. 193 (ill.).

Ulrike Lorenz, Otto Dix: Das Werkverzeichnis der Zeichnungen und Pastelle, vol. 2 (Weimar, 2003) p. 831, cat. No. EDV 9.2.17 (ill.).

Otto Dix Handzeichnungen, ed. Otto Conzelmann (Hannover, 1968), p.95, cat. 95 (ill.).

Suzanne Folds McCullagh (ed.), Drawings in Dialogue: Old Master Through Modern, The Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection, exh. cat. (Chicago: The Art Institute of Chicago, 2006), pp. 186-187, cat. 137 (ill.).
exhibition_history:
Berlin, Kronprinzenpalais, "Dix, Aquarellausstellung," 1924.

Freiburg, Kunstverein, "Otto Dix, Gemälde–Aquarelle–Zeichnung," 1950, cat. 70.

Düsseldorf, Kunstmuseum, "Otto Dix," 1960, cat. 117.

Berlin, Galerie Nierendorf, "Otto Dix, 1918–1960," 1961, cat. 15.

Darmstadt, Hessisches Landesmuseum, "Otto Dix," 1962, cat.70.

West Berlin, Kongresshalle, "Otto Dix," 1963, cat. 92.

Munich, Galerie Klihm, "Otto Dix," 1966, cat. 21.

Baden-Baden, Galerie Dr. Ernst Hauswedell, "Otto Dix, Handzeichnungen, 1911–1934," 1967, cat. 23.

Lörrach, Galerie Regio, "Otto Dix–Erich Heckel–Karl Schmidt-Rottluff," 1968, cat.8.

Art Institute of Chicago, "Drawings in Dialogue: Old Master Through Modern, The Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection," June 3–July 30, 2006, pp. 186-187, cat. 137 (ill.).

Art Institute of Chicago, "The Thrill of the Chase: Drawings for the Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection," March 15-June 15, 2014, no cat.
provenance_text: Galerie Nierendorf, Berlin, by Jan. 1961-at least Oct. 1963.  Sold, Kunsthaus Math. Lempertz, Cologne, Dec. 1965, lot 211.  Galerie Klihm, Munich, by Nov. 1966.  Galerie Dr. Ernst Hauswedell, Baden-Baden, Sept. 1967. Galerie Regio, Lorrach, by Aug. 1968.  Galerie Klihm, Munich.  Private colelction, New York;  sold, Sotheby’s, New York, Feb. 23, 1993, lot 49, to Dorothy Braude Edinburg, Brookline, MA; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 2013.
